s.label: Telescope model settings
s.desc: These parameters specify the contents of the telescope model.

s.label: Input directory
s.desc: Path to a directory containing the telescope configuration data. See the accompanying documentation for a description of an OSKAR telescope model directory.

s.label: Normalise beams at phase centre
s.desc: If true, then scale the amplitude of every station beam at the interferometer phase centre to precisely 1.0 for each time snapshot. This effectively performs an amplitude calibration for a source at the phase centre.

s.label: Allow station beam duplication
s.desc: If enabled, the station type map from the telescope model is used to duplicate beams from common station configurations. This can significantly reduce the simulation time if there are only a limited number of station types, but when using a telescope model with long baselines, source positions will not shift with respect to each station's horizon if this option is enabled.

s.label: Polarisation mode
s.desc: The polarisation mode of simulations which use the telescope model. If this is Scalar, then only Stokes I visibility data will be simulated, and scalar element responses will be used when evaluating station beams. If this is Full (the default) then correlation products from both polarisations will be simulated. Note that scalar mode can be significantly faster.

s.label: Station type
s.desc: The type of each station in the interferometer. A simple, time-invariant Gaussian station beam can be used instead of an aperture array beam if required for testing. All station beam effects can be disabled by selecting 'Isotropic beam'.

s.label: Gaussian FWHM [deg]
s.desc: For stations using a simple Gaussian beam, this setting gives the full-width half maximum value of the Gaussian station beam at the reference frequency, in degrees.

s.label: Reference frequency [Hz]
s.desc: The reference frequency of the specified FWHM, in Hz.

s.label: Ionosphere screen type
s.desc: Type of ionospheric phase screen to use.

s.label: Input FITS file
s.desc: Path to a FITS file written by ARatmospy to use as a TEC screen.

s.label: Screen height [km]
s.desc: Height of ionospheric screen, in kilometres.

s.label: Screen pixel size [m]
s.desc: Pixel size of ionospheric screen, in metres.

s.label: Assume isoplanatic screen
s.desc: If true, phase screens will be treated as isoplanatic, i.e. the same value will be used for all sources in the field.
